interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/01/17
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Producers': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Starring': ['Larry David', 'Jeff Garlin', 'Cheryl Hines'], 'Studio': ['Discovery Global']}
Review Text: Larry David, the writer/performer responsible for creating 'Seinfeld' w/Jerry Seinfeld, is the world's most self-centered narcissist in the sublimely hilarious 'Curb Your Enthusiasm'. His personal relationships, marriage and interactions with people are all awkward opportunities that showcase the world isn't following his set of sometimes bizarre thoughts and rules. Consistently funny and headshaking!
Review Title: 'Curb Your Enthusiasm': for the self-centered narcissist in us all
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Takers [Blu-ray] Paul Walker (Actor), Hayden Christensen (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['This high-stakes action thriller stars Matt Dillon, Paul Walker, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Michael Ealy and Tip “T.I.” Harris. After pulling off a spectacular series of brilliantly planned bank robberies, a notorious team of professional criminals attempts one last heist, a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring the', 'Takers', 'down. Chris Brown and Hayden Christensen costar in an adrenaline-rushed thrill ride packed with twists and turns.'] {'Genre': 'Action, Drama', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15423113', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 18, 2011', 'Actors': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} The only true robbery is by anyone buying this movie. It had been a long time since I've seen an action movie with such a combination of bad acting, horrible directing, a snoozer for a script and a cast that couldn't deliver their lines with any sort of skills. Rappers, C-list movie stars and singers make up this woeful cast of 'professional' bank robbers who only 'take' the big ones... the major chase scenes are so ridiculous you will roll your eyes and shake your head as you watch them.... there was a host of reasons a sequel wasn't made. Ugh.... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard'], 'Studio': ['FX Cable Channel']} After finally taking advantage of my Amazon Prime membership's video feature the first show I began watching was "Justified' after hearing people (most notable Robin Quivers) say how good it is. I have to agree- it's well acted, written and directed. My favorite actor on the show after Timothy Olyphant is Erica Tazel. Enjoying discovering 'Justified'! {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Chappelle', 'Ernest R. Colesberry', 'Nina Kostroff Noble'], 'Starring': ['Dominic West', 'Sonja Sohn', 'Lance Reddick'], 'Studio': ['HBO Max']} Season 2 was a great successor to the 1st season- plenty of intrigue, crime, kingpins rising and falling. "The Wire" was an underrated gem! Flat out great! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Rudd Simmons', 'Terence Winter', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Tim Van Patten', 'Stephen Levinson', 'Mark Wahlberg'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Steve Buscemi is great in this series about Atlantic City, bootlegging and the rise of some of the most famous gangsters in American history. Nearly perfect {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alan Ball', 'Daniel Attias', 'Rodrigo García', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Kathy Bates', 'Michael Cuesta', 'Michael Engler', 'Alan Poul', 'Daniel Minahan', 'Miguel Arteta'], 'Producers': ['Alan Ball', 'Robert Greenblatt', 'David Janollari', 'Alan Poul', 'Bruce Eric Kaplan', 'Rick Cleveland', 'Bob Del Valle', 'Lori Jo Nemhauser', 'Craig Wright'], 'Starring': ['Peter Krause', 'Michael C. Hall', 'Frances Conroy'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} A great show that was ahead of its time. Great cast, writing and directing {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Mikkel Bondesen', 'Pieter Jan Brugge', 'Jan David Frouman'], 'Starring': ['Titus Welliver', 'Jamie Hector', 'Amy Aquino'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Well written and directed, 'Bosch' is a taut and well paced series with a very good cast.

I look forward to seeing a second season. 'Bosch' is very good with a stellar cast {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Branagh'], 'Producers': ['David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Paul Schwake', 'Mace Neufeld', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura', 'David Barron', 'Mark Vahradian'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pine', 'Kevin Costner', 'Kenneth Branagh']} Hmmm... Chris Pine simply doesn't have the presence that I expect from this role and Keiera Knightly was simply annoying and distracting as his love interest.

Mr. Branaugh had directed other action films with similar underwhelming results (the first 'Thor' movie nearly put me to sleep)... This was a decently entertaining movie but not overly satisfying.

IF there is a sequel diminishing Ms. Knightly's character and more emphasis on the action involving Mr Ryan would be my advice. Not enough emphasis on the main character, too much on his wife, poorly directed {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Ohh so good! Thumbs up to season 2! Nucky gets in a major jam and his reign at the top is threatened by those who respect and revile him yet you find out why he is no one to underestimate. Season 2- the entertainment value and drama gets kicked up a few levels Archer Comedy, Animation, Action ['Archer is an animated, half-hour comedy that revolves around an international spy agency and its employees. Although their work is daunting, every covert operation and global crisis are occasions for the staff to undermine, sabotage and betray each other for personal gains, pleasures and prosperity. An FX Networks Original Series.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Fordney', 'Mack Williams', 'Matt Thompson', 'Casey Willis', 'Pierre Cerrato', 'Justin Wagner', 'Chi Duong', 'Megan Johnson', 'Chad Hurd', 'Marcus Rosentrater'], 'Producers': ['Fox']} Changing the entire premise of Archer for season 5 was IMHO an unfunny terrible ideal. I found very little to laugh at and a lot of the setups seemed lame and stretched out way too long. Why? {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Producers': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Starring': ['Larry David', 'Jeff Garlin', 'Cheryl Hines'], 'Studio': ['Discovery Global']} Larry David, the writer/performer responsible for creating 'Seinfeld' w/Jerry Seinfeld, is the world's most self-centered narcissist in the sublimely hilarious 'Curb Your Enthusiasm'. His personal relationships, marriage and interactions with people are all awkward opportunities that showcase the world isn't following his set of sometimes bizarre thoughts and rules. Consistently funny and headshaking! 'Curb Your Enthusiasm': for the self-centered narcissist in us all
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preferences:** The user maintains a strong preference for action and drama genres, with a noted appreciation for character complexity and development. Their recent review of a comedic series indicates an expanding tolerance for varied genres, particularly when execution aligns with their narrative standards.

- **Entertainment Quality:** The user consistently assigns high ratings, reflecting their expectation for engagement and entertainment. A recent impressive rating of 5.0 illustrates their enthusiasm for well-executed humor and character-driven storytelling, showing they remain highly engaged with quality content.

- **Rating Standards:** Their critical evaluation has evolved to recognize the effectiveness of humor in storytelling. The user's feedback illustrates a keen understanding of how narrative consistency impacts enjoyment, reinforcing the importance of quality across genres.

- **Engagement Style:** The user's analytical review style remains intact, emphasizing narrative execution and character exploration. Their ability to articulate what resonates or falls flat showcases a discerning taste that appreciates both depth and humor.

- **Interest in Star Power:** While the user values strong performance from cast members, their latest interaction highlights that effective storytelling is paramount, indicating a preference for quality narratives regardless of the actors involved.

Overall, the user exhibits a sophisticated and evolving taste, balancing an appreciation for compelling narratives with a discerning yet open-minded approach to diverse storytelling.
